alert.note: Alert for Butte; Glenn (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 9:31AM PDT until March 16 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River Near Hamilton City affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. Sacramento River Below Red Bluff Diversion Dam affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Ord Ferry affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. Sacramento River At Vina Woodson Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Tehama Bridge affecting Tehama County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River Above Bend Bridge affecting Tehama County. For the Upper Sacramento River...including Bend Bridge, Red Bluff Diversion Dam, Tehama Bridge, Vina Woodson Bridge, Hamilton City, Ord Ferry, Butte City, Moulton Weir, Colusa Weir, Colusa Bridge, Tisdale Weir...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sacramento River near Hamilton City. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 137.7 feet, West Sacramento Avenue and River Road north of Big Chico Creek flood 1.5 hours after the Hamilton City gage reaches 137.7-138.0 feet. At 147.2 feet, Overflow begins on the east bank of the river, from near Wilson Landing Road to Highway 32. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 145.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 147.8 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 147.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 147.9 feet on 02/27/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued this morning at 1045 AM PDT.
